alert.note: Alert for Warren (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 09 at 10:24PM EST until January 11 at 10:00AM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM EST MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy lake effect snow possible. Around 6 inches possible over northwest Warren County. 2 to 4 inches over the rest of Warren County. * WHERE...Warren County. * WHEN...From 9 AM EST Monday through Tuesday morning. The heaviest snow showers will fall Monday night into Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute.
info.instruction: There is the potential for significant winter weather that may impact travel. Review winter weather safety and preparedness information at weather.gov/winter. The latest forecast information can be found on the NWS State College Facebook page and Twitter @NWSStateCollege, or on the web at weather.gov/ctp.
